meanings.definition: A state of uncontrollable laughter or crying.
meanings.sent1: During the comedy show, the audience fell into hysterics at the comedian's jokes.
meanings.sent2: She burst into hysterics when she saw the puppy chasing its tail.
meanings.sent3: The movie was so funny that it sent everyone into hysterics.
meanings.sent4: Her contagious laughter spread through the room like a wave of hysterics.
meanings.sent5: The children's giggles turned into full-blown hysterics as they played together.

meanings.definition: Behavior exhibiting excessive or uncontrollable emotion.
meanings.sent1: His hysterics during the argument made it difficult to have a calm discussion.
meanings.sent2: The actress's hysterics on stage were so convincing that the audience was moved to tears.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's tantrum turned into full-blown hysterics in the middle of the store.
meanings.sent4: The political speech incited hysterics among the crowd, leading to a chaotic scene.
meanings.sent5: The news of the surprise party sent her into hysterics of joy and excitement.
